meanings.definition: To stop or hinder the growth or development of something.
meanings.sent1: The heavy rain will stum the plants from growing tall.
meanings.sent2: The fence accidentally stummed the tree's branches from spreading freely.
meanings.sent3: Trying to run with untied shoelaces can stum your speed.
meanings.sent4: Lack of proper nutrition can stum a child's physical growth.
meanings.sent5: The thick fog seemed to stum the progress of the construction work.

meanings.definition: A liquid used in winemaking, consisting of grape juice and skins that have been fermented.
meanings.sent1: The winemaker poured the sweet stum into the fermentation tank.
meanings.sent2: The cellar was filled with the aroma of freshly made stum.
meanings.sent3: The spilled stum on the floor attracted bees looking for a sugary treat.
meanings.sent4: The rich color of the stum reminded him of a beautiful sunset.
meanings.sent5: The stum bubbled gently as it underwent the fermentation process.
